casebody.data:
January 31, 1949.

Per Curiam Decision.

No. 429. Zimmerman v. Maryland. Argued January 14, 1949. Decided January 31, 1949. Mr. Justice Black, Mr. Justice Douglas, Mr. Justice Murphy and Mr. Justice Rutledge dissent. J. Cookman Boyd, Jr. argued the cause and filed a brief for petitioner. Hall Hammond, Attorney General of Maryland, argued the cause for respondent. With him on the brief was Richard W. Case, Assistant Attorney General. Per Curiam:

The judgment is affirmed. Akins v. Texas, 325 U. S. 398 (1945).
